user.title: Setup PV Management Fixed Price
user.description: Simplified PV management for fixed-price tariffs. Calculates amortization and optionally compares with spot prices.

data_description.name: Name for this PV system
data_description.pv_production_entity: Sensor measuring total PV production in kWh
data_description.grid_export_entity: Sensor for grid export in kWh (for earnings calculation)
data_description.grid_import_entity: Sensor for grid import in kWh (for spot comparison)
data_description.consumption_entity: Sensor for total household consumption in kWh
data_description.fixed_price: Net energy price from provider (e.g., 10.92 ct/kWh)
data_description.markup_factor: Factor for grid fees, taxes, VAT (Default: 2.0). Gross = Net × Factor
data_description.electricity_price_entity: Optional: Sensor for dynamic electricity price (overrides static energy price)
data_description.feed_in_tariff_unit: Choose if feed-in tariff is in Euro or Cent per kWh
data_description.installation_cost: Total cost of PV system including installation
data_description.installation_date: Date of installation for accurate statistics

abort.already_configured: This PV system has already been configured

sensors.title: Energy Sensors
sensors.description: Configure sensors for energy tracking and spot comparison.

data_description.pv_production_entity: Total kWh counter of PV system
data_description.grid_export_entity: Total kWh counter for grid export
data_description.grid_import_entity: Total kWh counter for grid import
data_description.consumption_entity: Total kWh counter for household consumption

prices.title: Electricity Prices & Amortization
prices.description: Electricity price = what you pay for grid import. Feed-in tariff = what you earn for export. Both can optionally use a sensor for dynamic values.

data_description.fixed_price: Static net energy price. Only used when NO sensor is selected.
data_description.markup_factor: Gross = Net × Factor. E.g. factor 2.0 turns 10ct net into 20ct gross.
data_description.electricity_price_entity: Sensor providing current electricity price (e.g. dynamic tariff). Overrides the static value above. Unit (ct/EUR) auto-detected.
data_description.feed_in_tariff_unit: Unit for the static fallback value below
data_description.feed_in_tariff: Static feed-in tariff. Only used when NO sensor is selected.
data_description.feed_in_tariff_entity: Sensor providing current feed-in tariff (e.g. market price). Overrides the static value above. Unit (ct/EUR) auto-detected.
data_description.installation_cost: Total cost of PV system (for amortization calculation)

offsets.title: Historical Data
offsets.description: If you have data from before tracking started.

data_description.savings_offset: If you already have an amortized amount (e.g., from previous tracking)
data_description.energy_offset_self_consumption: Self consumption kWh that occurred before this tracking
data_description.energy_offset_export: Export kWh that occurred before this tracking

quota.title: Electricity Quota
quota.description: Fixed-price tariff with yearly kWh quota. Shows if you're within budget.

data.quota_start_meter: Grid import meter reading at start date

data_description.quota_yearly_kwh: Your yearly quota in kWh (e.g., 4000 kWh)
data_description.quota_start_date: Start of tariff period (read from invoice, doesn't have to be Jan 1)
data_description.quota_start_meter: Grid import meter reading at start date (read from invoice/meter)
data_description.quota_monthly_rate: Optional: Monthly payment in EUR (display only)
data_description.quota_seasonal: Accounts for seasonal consumption patterns (more in winter, less in summer) for more realistic reserve and forecast values
